alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Northeast Johnson County; Southeast Johnson County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued April 02 at 5:46AM MDT until April 04 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow with total snow accumulations of 8 to 12 inches possible in the lower elevations and 10 to 16 inches in the mountains. North wind gusting 25 to 40 mph. * WHERE...Bighorn Mountains Southeast, Northeast Johnson County and Southeast Johnson County. * WHEN...From Monday afternoon through Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult Monday night and Tuesday morning. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...While snow may begin across far southern Johnson County Monday afternoon, the heaviest snow and strongest wind are expected from Monday evening through midday Tuesday. The heaviest snow is likely to fall in the southern Bighorn Range over far southern Johnson County near the Natrona County line.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. Make alternate plans now to avoid traveling Monday and Tuesday.

area.areaDesc: Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Northeast Johnson County; Southeast Johnson County
